alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 9:13PM MST until July 31 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MST/1130 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 911 PM MST /1011 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Cedar City Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain from thunderstorms had redeveloped and was moving toward Marble Canyon, Lees Ferry and into the Paria River basin. Area washes and creeks are likely still running very high. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marble Canyon, Lees Ferry, Grand Canyon National Park, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. This includes U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 537 and 550...and between mile markers 554 and 561...and near mile marker 588. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry and Cathedral Wash near Marble Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Badger Canyon, Rock Canyon, Fall Creek, South Fork Soap Creek, Coyote Wash, Paria River, House Rock Wash, Colorado River, Emmett Wash and Soap Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
